summary: This is the FBI Daily News Briefing for January 29, 2024, a compilation of news summaries from various media outlets. It covers a wide range of topics including national security, criminal investigations, counterterrorism, and political news. A notable section references an article asking why the FBI didn't stop Jeffrey Epstein decades earlier when two women reported abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in an article summary titled 'Two Women Tried to Expose Jeffrey Epstein Three Decades Ago. Why Didn't the FBI Stop Him?' which references the recent unsealing of documents and questions about the FBI's delayed prosecution.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Mentioned participating in a community basketball event and quoted on rising antisemitism. Also referenced in a story about a former FBI official violating the Hatch Act.

persons.name: Merrick Garland
persons.context: Quoted in multiple stories regarding violent crime initiatives, drug trafficking arrests, and the spike in threats against public figures.

persons.name: Timothy Thibault
persons.role: Former FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: Found to have violated the Hatch Act with anti-Trump social media posts. Whistleblowers had claimed he shut down investigations related to Hunter Biden.

persons.name: Charles McGonigal
persons.context: A convicted spy whose actions have prompted the FBI to review 22 years of high-level cases over fears of compromise.

persons.name: Andrew Cuomo
persons.context: Subject of a Justice Department settlement which found he sexually harassed more than a dozen state employees.

persons.name: Nikki Haley
persons.context: Revealed her parents were victims of a 'swatting' incident at their home in December.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: Suggested some pro-Palestinian protesters might be connected to Russia and called for an FBI investigation into their financing.

persons.name: Alejandro Mayorkas
persons.context: Subject of impeachment articles released by House Republicans over his handling of migration at the U.S.-Mexico border.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in numerous articles, including the Supreme Court case on his eligibility, defamation trial, and references to January 6 defendants as 'hostages'.

persons.name: Lisa Monaco
persons.context: Quoted regarding drug trafficking arrests and the FBI's dismantling of the Blackcat ransomware group.

persons.name: Matthew Graves
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the District of Columbia
persons.context: Quoted extensively on new federal resources to combat violent crime and carjackings in Washington, D.C.

persons.name: Letitia James
persons.context: Her 2021 report on Andrew Cuomo was referenced in the Justice Department's settlement announcement.

persons.name: Chuck Grassley
persons.context: Referred former FBI official Timothy Thibault for Hatch Act investigation, emphasizing need for non-partisanship.

persons.name: Ken Paxton
persons.context: Mentioned in an article about a state senator asking to reopen his impeachment case, which stemmed from whistleblowers going to the FBI.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Mentioned in various political and policy news summaries throughout the briefing.

connections.description: Thibault was found to have violated the Hatch Act with anti-Trump social media posts, and whistleblowers claimed he influenced an investigation into Trump.
McGonigal was convicted for conspiring with sanctioned Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska.
Attorney General Letitia James authored a 2021 report that concluded Cuomo sexually harassed at least 11 women, which was referenced in the DOJ settlement.
Whistleblowers from Paxton's office went to the FBI more than three years ago to report allegations against him, leading to his impeachment.

events.title: Farmer Sisters Report Epstein to FBI
events.description: Referenced in an article summary stating that two women tried to expose Jeffrey Epstein to the FBI after being molested, questioning why the FBI didn't stop him then.

events.title: FBI Daily News Briefing Published
events.description: Compilation of news summaries from various media outlets covering national security, criminal investigations, and political news.

events.title: Swatting Incident at Nikki Haley's Parents' Home
events.description: A false 911 call led law enforcement with guns drawn to the home of Nikki Haley's parents on Kiawah Island, South Carolina.

events.title: Justice Department Settles with NY Over Cuomo Harassment
events.description: The DOJ announced a settlement with New York State, confirming findings that former Gov. Andrew Cuomo sexually harassed more than a dozen state employees.

events.title: FBI Dismantles Blackcat Ransomware Group
events.description: The FBI announced it had infiltrated the Russian cybercriminal group ALPHV/BlackCat, seizing its dark website and obtaining decryption keys.

keyFacts: The document is an FBI Daily News Briefing, a compilation of media summaries, not an internal investigative document.
A referenced article asks 'Why Didn't the FBI Stop Him?' regarding Jeffrey Epstein, noting two women tried to expose him three decades ago.
Former FBI official Timothy Thibault was found to have violated the Hatch Act with anti-Trump social media posts.
The Justice Department settled with New York State, finding former Gov. Andrew Cuomo sexually harassed employees.
The FBI is reviewing 22 years of cases over fears of compromise by convicted former counterintelligence official Charles McGonigal.
